page.title: 03CRAWLEY: A GEOGRAPHY
page.content: This area is part of a planned{New {Town,}and includes the core of{old {Crawley.}Self-contained{neighbourhoods zone services, e.g. shops, school, church, open space, pub, with housing.Examples are Southgate, Ifield and the new Bewbush estates. Town centre{Queen's Square}has replaced {High Street}as the shopping focus and new offices have sprung up in this region of prosperity and population growth near{Gatwick}and{M23.}Past transport changes brought growth to the town as coaches, trains and motorists in turn travelled the{London {-Brighton}route. The railway bisects the area giving the passenger glimpses of old terrace rows and new estates. Roads are planned to give views of green open space. Much of the area is low and flat but sand ridges and{Mole tributary valleys add interest.
